recipe_name: Versatile Veggie Burritos & Freezable Breakfast Burritos
ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: 1. Prep all vegetables as directed: chop onion, mince garlic and jalapeños, dice zucchini, red pepper, and tomato.
2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté onions for 6-8 minutes until softened. Add garlic and jalapeños, sauté for 2 minutes.
3. Add zucchini and red pepper, sauté for 8-10 minutes until slightly softened and starting to brown.
4. Add corn and tomato, sauté for 2-3 minutes. Stir in quinoa, black beans, cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, and salt. Heat through.
5. Taste and adjust seasonings. Stir in cilantro and remove from heat.
6. Fill tortillas with veggie mixture and cheese (optional). Roll up tightly, closing the ends.
7. Serve immediately or freeze individually wrapped in foil/parchment.
1. Scramble eggs. Dice and fry potatoes. Sauté diced green pepper. Cook bacon or sausage and dice.
3. Fill tortillas with eggs, potatoes, green pepper, bacon/sausage, and salsa. Roll up tightly, tucking in the ends.
4. Wrap individually in plastic wrap and store in a freezer bag.
5. Reheat in the microwave for 3-5 minutes when ready to serve.
cooking_tips: For freezing burritos, ensure they are tightly wrapped to prevent freezer burn.
Thaw frozen burritos overnight in the refrigerator or microwave until heated through.
Adjust the amount of spices to your preference.
Add other vegetables like mushrooms or spinach to the veggie burrito filling.
Customize breakfast burritos with your favorite fillings like cheese, onions, or avocado.
